      • regularUserRegister

        public java.lang.String regularUserRegister(java.lang.String id,
                                            java.lang.String name,
                                            java.lang.String vinculationDate)
        This Java function registers a regular user with an ID, name, and vinculation date and adds them to a list of users.
        Parameters:
        id - A unique identifier for the regular user being registered.
        name - The name of the regular user being registered.
        vinculationDate - vinculationDate is a String parameter representing the date on which the user is being registered. It is parsed into a LocalDate object using the `LocalDate.parse()` method.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a String message "User registered successfully".

      • premiumUserRegister

        public java.lang.String premiumUserRegister(java.lang.String id,
                                            java.lang.String name,
                                            java.lang.String vinculationDate)
        The function registers a new premium user with the given ID, name, and vinculation date.
        Parameters:
        id - A unique identifier for the premium user being registered.
        name - The name of the premium user being registered.
        vinculationDate - vinculationDate is a String parameter representing the date on which the PremiumUser is being registered. It is parsed into a LocalDate object using the LocalDate.parse() method.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a String message "User registered successfully".

      • bookRegister

        public java.lang.String bookRegister(java.lang.String id,
                                     java.lang.String name,
                                     java.lang.String description,
                                     java.lang.String publicationDate,
                                     java.lang.String gander,
                                     java.lang.String url,
                                     double saleValue,
                                     int numberPag)
        The function registers a book with its details and adds it to a list of products.
        Parameters:
        id - A unique identifier for the book.
        name - The name of the book being registered.
        description - The description parameter is a String that describes the book being registered. It may include information about the plot, genre, author, or any other relevant details about the book.
        publicationDate - The publication date of the book in the format of "yyyy-MM-dd".
        gander - "gander" is a parameter that represents the gender or category of the book. It is passed as a String and then converted to an enum type "BookGander" using the "valueOf" method. The "BookGander" enum type is used to categorize books into different genres such as
        url - The "url" parameter in the "bookRegister" method is a String variable that represents the URL (Uniform Resource Locator) of the book. It is used to store the web address of the book's online location, if applicable.
        saleValue - The parameter "saleValue" is not used in the given method, so it is not relevant to the book registration process.
        numberPag - The parameter "numberPag" represents the number of pages in the book being registered.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a String message "Book registered successfully".

      • magazineRegister

        public java.lang.String magazineRegister(java.lang.String id,
                                         java.lang.String name,
                                         java.lang.String publicationDate,
                                         java.lang.String category,
                                         java.lang.String url,
                                         java.lang.String periodicity,
                                         double suscriptionValue,
                                         int numberPag)
        The function registers a new magazine with its details and adds it to a list of products.
        Parameters:
        id - A unique identifier for the magazine.
        name - The name of the magazine being registered.
        publicationDate - The date of publication of the magazine in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
        category - The category of the magazine, represented as a String. It is later converted to the enum type MagazineCategory.
        url - The URL is a string that represents the web address of the magazine's website or online version.
        periodicity - The frequency at which the magazine is published, such as "daily", "weekly", "monthly", etc.
        suscriptionValue - The subscription value is the amount of money that a person has to pay to subscribe to the magazine for a certain period of time.
        numberPag - numberPag refers to the number of pages in the magazine.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a String message "Magazine registered successfully" after adding a new Magazine object to the list of products.

      • validateBookID

        public boolean validateBookID(java.lang.String productID)
        This function validates if a given product ID belongs to a book in a list of products.
        Parameters:
        productID - a String representing the ID of a book product that needs to be validated.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a boolean value, which indicates whether the given product ID is valid or not. If the product ID matches with the ID of any book in the list of products, the method returns true, otherwise it returns false.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A boolean value indicating whether the given product ID is valid or not.

      • validateAlfanumerical

        public boolean validateAlfanumerical(java.lang.String product)
        The function checks if a given string contains only alphanumeric characters.
        Parameters:
        product - The input string that needs to be validated for containing only alphanumeric characters.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a boolean value, which indicates whether the input string contains only alphanumeric characters (letters and/or numbers). If the string contains any other characters, the method returns false.

      • modifyBook

        public java.lang.String modifyBook(java.lang.String productID,
                                   int info,
                                   java.lang.String modified)
        This Java function modifies a book object based on the specified information and returns a message indicating whether the modification was successful or not.
        Parameters:
        productID - A string representing the unique identifier of a book.
        info - an integer representing which information of the book to modify (1 for product ID, 2 for product name, 3 for publication date, 4 for URL, 5 for description, 6 for number of pages, 7 for value of the book, 8 for book gander)
        modified - The new value that will replace the existing value of the book's information.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a String message indicating whether the book was modified successfully or if it does not exist.

        Parameters:
        productID - A string representing the ID of the magazine to be modified.
        info - an integer representing the type of information to modify in the Magazine object. The possible values are:
        modified - The new value that will replace the current value of the specified information (info) for the magazine with the given productID.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a String message indicating whether the magazine was modified successfully or not.

      • searchMagazine

        public Magazine searchMagazine(java.lang.String productID)
        This Java function searches for a magazine object in a list of products based on a given product ID.
        Parameters:
        productID - a String variable representing the unique identifier of a magazine product that needs to be searched in a list of products. The method returns a Magazine object that matches the given productID.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a Magazine object that matches the given productID. If no Magazine object is found with the given productID, the method returns null.

      • affordarProduct

        public java.lang.String affordarProduct(java.lang.String id,
                                        java.lang.String productID)
        This Java function allows a user to purchase a product if they have enough funds and updates their account accordingly.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the user who wants to purchase the product.
        productID - The ID of the product that the user wants to purchase.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a String message indicating whether the product has been successfully purchased or not. If the product is successfully purchased, the message will be "The product has been successfully purchased". If the product cannot be purchased, the message will be "Could not add product".

        Returns:

      • readSimulation

        public java.lang.String readSimulation(java.lang.String productID,
                                       int numberPagRead,
                                       java.lang.String id)
        This function reads a certain number of pages of a given product and updates the user's reading progress, while also generating a commercial message if the user has read a certain number of pages.
        Parameters:
        productID - a String representing the ID of the product being read
        numberPagRead - The current page number being read by the user.
        id - The username or ID of the user who is reading the product.
        Returns:
        The method returns a String message that depends on the input parameters and the state of the system. The possible messages are: - "You can't go back, you're on the first page of the book." - "Username does not exist" - "You can not advance the page, you are in the last one" - A message that includes the title of the product, the number of pages

        Returns:
        The method is returning a String that contains the total number of pages read in books and magazines.

      • mostRead

        public java.lang.String mostRead()

        Returns:

      • amountPagGenre

        public int amountPagGenre(BookGander z)
        This Java function calculates the total number of pages read for a given book genre.
        Parameters:
        z - The parameter "z" is an object of the BookGander class, which is used to specify the gender of the book for which the total number of pages needs to be calculated.
        Returns:
        The method is returning an integer value which represents the total number of pages read for books of a specific genre (specified by the BookGander parameter).

      • amountPagCategory

        public int amountPagCategory(MagazineCategory z)
        This Java function calculates the total number of pages in magazines belonging to a specific category.
        Parameters:
        z - The parameter "z" is of type MagazineCategory, which is an enum representing the category of a magazine (e.g. sports, fashion, technology, etc.). It is used to filter the magazines in the products list and calculate the total number of pages for magazines in the specified category.
        Returns:
        The method `amountPagCategory` returns an integer value which represents the total number of pages of magazines in the specified category `z`.

        Returns:
        The method is returning an integer value which represents the total number of copies sold for a specific book gander (either male or female).

      • totalSoldBook

        public double totalSoldBook(BookGander gander)
        The function calculates the total revenue generated from selling books of a specific gender.
        Parameters:
        gander - The parameter "gander" is likely referring to the gender of the book's intended audience. It is used to calculate the total amount of money earned from selling books of a specific gender.
        Returns:
        The method `totalSoldBook` returns a `double` value which represents the total amount of money earned from selling books of a specific gender (`gander`).

      • infoCategoryMagazine

        public java.lang.String infoCategoryMagazine()
        The function returns a string that contains information about the number of active subscriptions and total sold magazines for each category.
        Returns:
        The method `infoCategoryMagazine()` is returning a string that represents a matrix of information about the different categories of magazines. The matrix contains three rows: the first row contains the names of the categories, the second row contains the number of active subscriptions for each category, and the third row contains the total number of magazines sold for each category.

      • numberSuscritionActive

        public int numberSuscritionActive(MagazineCategory category)
        This function returns the total number of active subscriptions for a given magazine category.
        Parameters:
        category - a MagazineCategory enum representing the category of magazines to count the number of active subscriptions for.
        Returns:
        The method is returning an integer value which represents the total number of active subscriptions for magazines in the specified category.

      • totalSoldMagazine

        public double totalSoldMagazine(MagazineCategory category)
        This function calculates the total revenue generated by a specific category of magazines based on the number of active subscriptions and their subscription value.
        Parameters:
        category - The category of the magazine for which the total sold value needs to be calculated.
        Returns:
        The method `totalSoldMagazine` returns a `double` value which represents the total amount of money earned from selling magazines of a specific category.

      • showMatriz

        public java.lang.String showMatriz(java.lang.String[][] matriz)
        The function takes a 2D array of strings and returns a string representation of the array with each element separated by a space and each row separated by a newline character.
        Parameters:
        matriz - a 2-dimensional array of Strings that represents a matrix.
        Returns:
        The method `showMatriz` returns a string representation of a 2D array of strings (`String[][]`). The string contains the elements of the array separated by spaces and new lines to represent the rows and columns of the array.

        The function returns a string containing the product IDs of all the books in a list of products.

        The method `showIdBooks()` returns a string containing the product IDs of all the products in the `products` list that are instances of the `Book` class.

      • saveLibrary

        public java.lang.String saveLibrary(java.lang.String idUser,
                                    java.lang.String id)
        This Java function adds a book or magazine to a user's library if the user exists and the product ID is valid.
        Parameters:
        idUser - The ID of the user whose library needs to be updated.
        id - The parameter "id" is a String variable representing the ID of a book or magazine that needs to be added to a user's library.
        Returns:
        The method returns a String message indicating whether the product has been successfully added to the user's library or not. The possible messages are "The product has been added", "The product does not exist", and "It has not been possible to add".

      • showLibrary

        public java.lang.String showLibrary(java.lang.String id)
        This function takes an ID as input and returns the information of the user with that ID or a message indicating that the user does not exist.
        Parameters:
        id - The parameter "id" is a String variable that represents the unique identifier of a user in a library system. The method "showLibrary" takes this parameter as input and searches for a user with the matching id in the "users" list. If a user with the matching id is found, the
        Returns:
        If a user with the given ID exists in the "users" list, the method will return the result of calling the "show()" method on that user object. If no user with the given ID is found, the method will return the string "The user does not exist".
